SENTENCE.STRING: is located in the Sierra Nevada Mountains of the U.S. state of California, 2 miles (3 km) south of Mount Dana.
was named after Oliver Gibbs, a professor at Harvard University and friend of Josiah Whitney.
peak lies on the boundary between Yosemite National Park and Inyo National Forest.
The peak is accessible either from the west, starting at Tioga Pass Road, or from the east, via Bloody Canyon from the trailhead at Walker Lake.
(Overnight camping is not permitted on the western side of
, which is part of the protected watershed of Dana Meadows and Tioga Pass.)
has only patchy snow, on the northern slope.
The easiest ascent is via the ridge extending west from the peak; there is a steep section of loose, unstable rocks, leading to the gentle ridge that forms the top of
Although the top is above the tree line, there is some sparse plant life, including wildflowers.
The view of Mono Lake from the summit is partially obstructed by an outcropping to the northeast.
